Located_in: inner third of Dentate gyrus molecular layer
Comment: This class is still under review and requires changes before making it final. In the mean time
Dentate gyrus MOPP cell.Definition: The Dentate Gyrus MOPP cell (molecular layer perforant path-associated cell) is a interneuron in hippocampal formation. It is located deep in the DG molecular layer, has a multipolar or triangular cell body and gives rise to an axon that produces a substantial terminal plexus largely limited to the outer two thirds of the DG molecular layer.
